title: Ticket #7651: OFFLINE_MACHINE_RESOURCE_<tag> should work on reconfig for d-slots
description:
the configuration OFFLINE_MACHINE_RESOURCE_<tag> is currently only read on startup of the Startd. It would be more useful if it was also read on reconfig.

This will require some special case code in the Startd because we cant reassign resources on reconfig, so the code will have to pick up the offline knob, and then Adjust the Offline<Tag> attribute in the p-slot and all unclaimed slots. It will then have to pay attention to the Offline<Tag> attribute when moving GPUs between d-slot and p-slot, and when reporting the number of resources through the <Tag> attribute and Total<Tag> attribute.

this will have the effect of making it a restart pref for partitionable slots, and allow Static slots the opportunity to choose to not match jobs if their GPUs go offline.

Resources that are marked offline at startup will still require a restart to put them online, because the offline resources will not be assigned to any slot.

Resources that are marked offline after the Startd has assigned resources, will be added to the offline list, but will not removed from any of the slot resource assignments. Thus resources that are marked offline at runtime, can be put back online at runtime as well, with the original slot resource assignments preserved.

GPUs example

In the following example, GPU device indices are used to make the example easier to read, but If you use offline resources, and particularly if you use nvidia-smi to drain GPUs, you should add the -short-uuid or -uuid option to GPU_DISCOVERY_EXTRA in your configuration so that GPUS have stable identifiers such as GPU-af3457b1 instead of CUDA1.

The following config 

config fragment
MACHINE_RESOURCE_GPUs=CUDA0, CUDA1, CUDA2
OFFLINE_MACHINE_RESOURCE_GPUS=CUDA1
Could result in the following slot attributes 
Name = "slot1@bob"
GPUs = 1
TotalGPUs = 2
AssignedGPUs = "CUDA0, CUDA2"
OfflineGPUs = "CUDA1"

Name "slot1_1@bob"
GPUs = 1
TotalGPUs = 2
AssignedGPUs = "CUDA0"
OfflineGPUS = "CUDA1"

If you then change the config to this 

config fragment
MACHINE_RESOURCE_GPUs=CUDA0, CUDA1, CUDA2
OFFLINE_MACHINE_RESOURCE_GPUS=CUDA0
And reconfig but not restart, the slot attributes should change to this until the job in the d-slot completes 

Name = "slot1@bob"
GPUs = 1
TotalGPUs = 1
AssignedGPUs = "CUDA0, CUDA2"
OfflineGPUs = "CUDA0,CUDA1"

Name "slot1_1@bob"
GPUs = 0
TotalGPUs = 1
AssignedGPUs = "CUDA0"
OfflineGPUS = "CUDA0,CUDA1"

Since CUDA1 was offline at startup, it remains offline. Also the count of GPUs in the d-slot is now 0. Because of this, when the current job completes, the d-slot will no longer match a GPU requesting job, and will likely be deleted. Any new d-slot will be assigned CUDA2 since that is the only non-offline GPU assigned to the p-slot.
